Merge pull request #71 from menny/master

More issues for release v81
trying to figure out why contacts are not reloaded upon change
new SDK version
updated translations

issue 72: changes in the contacts list did not cause a reload in ASK. Had a really bad reference issue there, which caused the unregister to be called *every* time the onInputEnded was called, which is not good, and when a new instance was requested, a cached instance was given, meaning the registeration was not happening again. Also, fix some deprated interface thingy in the Observer and API16.
finalizing contacts things (including missing file), and updating changelog

Unicode characters for default arrow keys instead of pictures
trying to clear references, so less memory will be used - got a lot of OutOfMemory errors from users
moving the drawables into builders, so the memory footprint is smaller.
found incorrect behavior with onDetachedFromWindow. And some more context leaks.

View.onDetachFromWindow IS NOT Activity.onDestroy equivalent! onDetachFromWindow maybe called many times in the life-cycle of a view (after onAttachedToWindow, of course). It should be used only as a way to release resources or such. #tip
better handling the restart input view event: now will not switch the layout if not needed. Was painful in webviews

Fixing NPE when clicking the 'More' link in the HomeFragment cards.
This was due to the restore-state call which restored the ClickSpan state of the text, where its on-click handler was refering to an old (dead) fragment.
removing redundant semi-colon.
when clicking on the Tips card in the main fragment, the Tips will open, with the random tip pre-selected. Some context, ah?

introducing a new master-switch preference. This is very similar to CheckBoxPreference, but will use a different widget: in API14 and higher it will use the Switch View, while in prior Androids it will use ToggleButton
optimizing images for smaller sizes. Did not loss too much.
adding 'additional software licenses' page to the App. Issue #231

adding a generic background for clickable items. Issue #232

Issue #296. The key preview settings title was pointing to the wrong resource.

Adding MultiTap support for the physical keyboard

There is a special use-case, which requires a special user-experience:
When the same character is repeating in the sequence (e.g., QQ), the user
is expecting that the output will be cyclular, unlike when the the sequence
includes non-repeating letters (e.g., QE) where the expectation is that there
will not be a cyclic output.
